thread.title: Martin Truex Jr. qualifies seventh for Sunday's race in Kansas
thread.title_full: Martin Truex Jr. qualifies seventh for Sunday's race in Kansas - The Denver Post

author: Mike Chambers
title: Martin Truex Jr. qualifies seventh for Sunday's race in Kansas
text:
KANSAS CITY, Kan. — Returning to the track where they led a race-high 95 laps on May 9, Furniture Row Racing and driver Martin Truex Jr. on Friday qualified seventh for Sunday's Chase for the Championship event at Kansas Speedway.
The title-contending, Denver-based team has confidence at the 1.5-mile oval, where Truex settled for a ninth-place finish in the spring race when a dominant day was tarnished by a back-firing, late-race pit stop.
"It was a good day, a challenging day," Truex said immediately after qualifying Friday. "We just figured out that we had something screwed up pretty bad."
He declined to identify the problem. "One of the settings on the car was off from what we thought it was — by a lot — and we fought around that all day long," Truex said. "So that held us up a bit. We felt it should have been faster than it was. But we'll fix it."
Sunday's Hollywood Casino 400 is the fifth of 10 playoff races, and Truex is among 12 drivers in the hunt for the championship. He is third in the standings, seven points behind leader Joey Logano and one behind Kevin Harvick.
The Chase began with 16 drivers and it will shrink to eight after next week's race at Talladega, Ala. Logano — who won last week at Charlotte, N.C., to begin the second playoff stint — is the only driver to secure an Elite Eight berth, by virtue of that win.
